items.title: City Housing Projects Call For Environmental Help
items.abstract: Housing project residents say the city encouraged them to “go green,” but did little to help them and in some circumstances, stood in their way.

items.title: In Rural Minnesota, a 70-Acre Lab for Sustainable Living
items.abstract: Imagine a house that can go without heating for two days in a bitterly cold winter. Or a greenhouse with what may be the largest hot-air solar panel array in North America.

items.title: Charting a Post-Pollution Path for Cities – From London, 1952, through Beijing, 2013
items.abstract: Facing epic smog, China charts a shift from coal to gas for Beijing, and beyond.

items.title: Wild’s Big Signings Reinvigorate a ‘Hockey-Crazy City’
items.abstract: Declining attendance and lackluster play prompted the Wild owner to lavish identical 13-year, $98 million contracts on the high-profile free agents Zach Parise and Ryan Suter.

items.title: Mix Master
items.abstract: The French designer Matali Crasset on the pleasures of working in concrete.

items.title: ‘Design Thinking’ for a Better You
items.abstract: A strategy called “design thinking” has helped numerous entrepreneurs and engineers develop successful new products and businesses. But can design thinking help you create healthful habits?

items.title: Bitter Debate Over Nuclear Power Simmers in Rural South Korea
items.abstract: In 2010, three villages agreed to give up their land to make room for a power plant, plunging the area into a battle over whether the plant would be a savior or a death knell.

items.title: Taliban Step Up Urban Assaults, Testing the Mettle of Afghan Forces
items.abstract: The government is trying to reassure citizens while the Taliban appears to be trying to strengthen its hand before peace talks.

items.title: Pritzker Prize for Architecture Is Awarded to Alejandro Aravena of Chile
items.abstract: Mr. Aravena, who has focused on low-cost social housing and reconstructing after natural disasters, received the honor as Chile emerges as a locus of noteworthy architecture.

items.title: On the Stockholm Waterfront, ‘Renewing a New City’
items.abstract: Sustainable housing plans have transformed Hammarby Sjostad, a neighborhood in Stockholm. Now, new cultural projects are providing another boost.

items.title: ‘Broad City’ Is Ending. Be at Peace With That. The Creators Are.
items.abstract: In a freewheeling interview, Abbi Jacobson and Ilana Glazer, stars of “Broad City,” explain why they ended the show and why they look forward to life without it.

items.title: In a World of Fine Lines, Manchester City Tightens the Title Race
items.abstract: A game decided by the slightest of differences set the tone for a fierce battle for the Premier League between Liverpool and City (and perhaps Tottenham).

items.title: Mayor de Blasio Says Wealth Is ‘in the Wrong Hands,’ Pledges to Redistribute It
items.abstract: In his State of the City address, Mayor Bill de Blasio offered progressive promises and a new ferry between Staten Island and Manhattan’s West Side.

items.title: An Indian City Bursting With Action
items.abstract: The present-day version of Chennai in South India dates back to only the 1600s, so a relatively youthful exuberance should not come as a surprise.

items.title: His Art, Their Ideas: Did Robert Indiana Lose Control of His Work?
items.abstract: Private text messages entered as evidence in a legal dispute raise new questions about whether the artist fully designed his final works.

items.title: A New Mayor and a New Relationship Between City Hall and Albany
items.abstract: Unlike their feuding predecessors, Mayor Eric Adams and Gov. Kathy Hochul appear to be getting along. They have their reasons.

items.title: An Alabama Town’s Sewage Woes Test Biden’s Infrastructure Ambitions
items.abstract: The new law allocates $11.7 billion for wastewater and stormwater projects. Will it get to the impoverished communities who need it most?

items.title: America’s Most Energy Efficient Cities
items.abstract: A new report by the American Council for an Energy-Efficient Economy can help you gauge just how green your city is — or wants to be.

items.title: A Mayor and the Challenge of Making the City Safer
items.abstract: Eric Adams made public safety a campaign issue. Now, as mayor, he will be held accountable.

items.title: After Urban Flight, Corporate Campuses Add a Taste of the City
items.abstract: Suburban headquarters are being redesigned to add more amenities that will integrate better with their communities and attract the skilled workers.
